The card game itself is hours of fun - essentially, it's a game of Russian Roulette where the gameplay revolves around trying to change the odds and rig the game for everyone else. The developers did a great job translating this experience to a mobile format, but curiously left out one of the more interesting card types which allowed a player to Nope someone else's action, or Yep someone else's Nope. This was probably a wise move, though, considering the amount of grief this mechanic is capable of causing.<p style="background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;">Playing and reshuffling cards feels natural, and tapping a card in order to see more about its ability is a great feature. While there's no way to communicate with other players online, it doesn't seem like a chat feature would benefit the game at all.</p><p style="background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;">Being a mobile game, a certain amount of gameplay is lost to in-app purchases. The developers seem to be under the impression that players would like to buy additional avatars or card types after paying for the game itself. Fortunately, having just the base game doesn't detract from the experience at all.</p><p style="background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;"><span style="background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;">While I personally haven't had a chance to try it, players in the&nbsp;</span><span style="background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;"><a href="http://reddit.com/r/explodingkittens" style="background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;"></a><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;"><a href="http://reddit.com/r/explodingkittens" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,); background-position: 672px 0px; background-repeat: no-repeat;">subreddit</a>&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">seem to agree that the Party Pack adds enough new gameplay to justify the $2.67 price tag.</span><br></span></p>
